name: Old Fashioned
instructions: Put sugar in glass. Cover it with dashes of bitters. Add whiskey and stir until sugar dissolves. Add ice, stir again, and serve. If the barman starts shaking the ingredients or muddling fruit, have your next round at another bar.
description: There may be no better test of a bartender's mettle than ordering an Old Fashioned.

name: Margarita
instructions: Since this recipe includes fresh juice, it should be shaken. Serve over ice in a glass with a salted rim.
description: Cloyingly sweet margarita mixes have given this drink a bad name. A well-made version is a fresh mix of lime juice and tequila, with a hint of sweetener.

name: Cosmopolitan
description: The cosmo became almost ubiquitous in the '90s thanks to the TV show Sex and the City, but this spin on the martini remains just as tasty today as when Carrie Bradshaw made it famous.

name: Negroni
description: A favorite of bartenders all over the world, the Negroni is a simple three-ingredient cocktail.

name: MoscowMule
instructions: Squeeze lime juice into a Moscow Mule mug. Add two or three ice cubes, pour in the vodka, and fill with cold ginger beer. Stir and serve.
description: Popular for good reason, the Moscow Mule is one of the most refreshing things to sip on a hot summer day. Its suggested vessel, a copper mug, also just looks sharp.

name: Paloma
description: A great drink for the morning
